Headline: Building UserJot | Simple Feedback, Roadmaps & Changelogs for Modern SaaS
Comment:
This is spot on. The gap between what people say and what they do is massive.

We built UserJot partly because of this exact problem. Users tell you everything is fine in surveys, but when you give them a feedback board where they can vote, the real issues become obvious. The stuff with 50+ upvotes is what's actually driving people away.

The voting itself is the behavior that matters. They're taking time out of their day to find your board, submit feedback, and vote on others' ideas. That's 10x more signal than any satisfaction score.

Also noticed users who submit feedback have way higher retention. Not because we build everything they ask for, but because they're invested enough to engage.

Praise is nice but watching someone actively use your product to solve real problems beats any compliment.
processed_comment: this is spot on the gap between what people say and what they do is massive we built userjot partly because of this exact problem users tell you everything is fine in surveys but when you give them a feedback board where they can vote the real issues become obvious the stuff with upvotes is whats actually driving people away the voting itself is the behavior that matters theyre taking time out of their day to find your board submit feedback and vote on others ideas thats x more signal than any satisfaction score also noticed users who submit feedback have way higher retention not because we build everything they ask for but because theyre invested enough to engage praise is nice but watching someone actively use your product to solve real problems beats any compliment
